title: XV Anniversary of the Mathematics-Ecnomics Program
text:
At Aalborg University, we are excited to celebrate the 15th anniversary of the Mathematics-Economics program 🎉!
This milestone event will bring together students, alumni, faculty, and industry leaders to connect, reflect, and look ahead.

📅 Date: September 13, 2024
🕒 Time: 13:30 - 17:30 (Dinner from 18:00)
📍 Location: AAU Innovate, Thomas Manns Vej 25, 9220 Aalborg East

Why Attend?

👉 Panel Discussions: Gain insights from distinguished alumni.
👉 Program Evolution: Explore the history and future of our program.
👉 AI and the Future Job Market: Engage in forward-thinking dialogues.

The celebration will conclude with a gala dinner, offering an evening of good food and great conversation.
✍ Register today to save your spot: https://forms.office.com/e/mUwStPb8wY
🕒 Deadline for registration is August 30.
Seating for the dinner is limited, so make sure to register early. The event is free for everybody to attend. The price to join the dinner will be shared shortly.
For any questions regarding the event, please contact J. Eduardo Vera Valdés.
We look forward to celebrating with you!

title: About
text: The site is maintained by J. Eduardo Vera-Valdés. Report any issues here.

title: Department of Mathematical Sciences, Aalborg University
text:
This is the offsite page for the Department of Mathematical Sciences. You can find the official website here. This website is used for fast updates and hosting of events and research projects.

Earth Day and Climate Econometrics
The Department of Mathematical Sciences at Aalborg University is committed to the study of Climate Change and its impacts on society. It hosts the Climate AAU Hub, containing Climate Econometrics Research Projects and the yearly Earth Day Events.


XV Anniversary of the Mathematics-Ecnomics Program
The Mathematics-Economics Program at Aalborg University celebrates its 15th anniversary. The Department is hosting an event to bring together students, alumni, faculty, and industry leaders to connect, reflect, and look ahead. You can find more information here.
